_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:05:39 using v2.0
title: How easy did patients find it to get through to someone at the GP surgery on the phone?
analysis_commentary:
The survey results for January - September 2013 was based on 943,138 replies, which is a response rate of 35%.

The majority of patients said they found it easy to get through to someone at their GP surgery on the phone and this has been improving since the survey started. The percentage of patients finding it easy to get through to the GP surgery on the phone has risen from 65% (+/- 0.6%) in 2009/10 to 75% (+/- 1.2%) in 2012/13, although that was a drop of 3% on the previous year in 2011/12. However, this means that approximately a quarter of patients still don't find it easy to get through on the phone. Current figures from January to September 2013 suggest that this percentage hasn't changed significantly.
